content:
Diagnosis:		Locally advanced pancreatic adenocarcinoma with peritoneal disease

Management:		Jan 2024 - Commenced FOLFIRINOX
		Mar 2024 - Dose reduction due to grade 3 neutropenia
		Apr 2024 - Changed to Gemcitabine/Nab-paclitaxel

Histology:		Moderately differentiated pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma
		GATA6 amplification positive
		Stage IIIB (T4N1M0)

Current Situation:	Pre-cycle 2 Gemcitabine/Nab-paclitaxel

[redacted name] has attended for review following the switch to second-line chemotherapy. The change from FOLFIRINOX was necessitated by cumulative myelosuppression despite G-CSF support and 20% dose reduction. CT performed on 15/4/24 shows encouraging 30% reduction in pancreatic mass and stable peritoneal disease. Performance status remains 1. Blood results today show improvement in neutrophils to 2.8 and platelets 156. The initial neuropathy has resolved. Appetite has improved with weight gain of 2kg since changing regimen.

Plan to proceed with cycle 2 Gemcitabine/Nab-paclitaxel at full dose. Will arrange CT reassessment after cycle 4. Review in 3 weeks with blood tests.

cancer_timeline.value: FOLFIRINOX dose reduced by 20% due to grade 3 neutropenia
Changed to Gemcitabine/Nab-paclitaxel regimen due to cumulative myelosuppression
CT shows 30% reduction in pancreatic mass and stable peritoneal disease

status_updates.value: Stage IIIB pancreatic cancer showing response to chemotherapy. Changed from FOLFIRINOX to Gemcitabine/Nab-paclitaxel due to toxicity.
30% reduction in pancreatic mass, stable peritoneal disease, weight gain of 2kg
Proceeding with cycle 2 Gemcitabine/Nab-paclitaxel at full dose
Review in 3 weeks with blood tests
